__e: Gosh, Dr. Smith. You aren't afraid of anything anymore.
It seems that Dr. Smith isn't going with you after all.
Don't tell me it's because Dr. Smith didn't catch any fish again.
Well, I know what he did was wrong, but-- but that's Dr. Smith.
- Dr. Smith, are you sure you know what you're doing?
I'll tell you why. Because for the first time in his life, he's going to have to tell the truth. That's going to be a whole new experience for our dear Dr. Smith.
Dr. Harris when are you going to let me out of this box?
Well, I didn't say it, but Doc Harris...
Dr Harris told us you had two weeks to live.
- You have Dr. Carter waiting for you.
Well, you know, Dr. Carter isn't sure yet.
Dr. Carter, may I see you a moment?
No. But, I expect one day Dr Watson will.
If you don't mind, Dr. Watson, I'd like to have a little talk with your brother, sir.
I'm sure Dr. Watson would do it for you.
I think I see what you're trying to do, Dr. Crane, and I just want you to know... it worked.
I find that when you say that to Dr. Crane, he stops talking.

You're thinking you're more sophisticated than me, and classier than me, and smarter than me, and that... and that you got better hair than mine, and that you're taller than me, and-and you got that strong jaw line.
